result.execSummary:
The defendant Wilmar M. Palmer Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Wilmar M. Palmer in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PLQ - colloquey given and knowing waiver accepted.  Ct 2 - dismissed, but read-in.  Ct 1 - no contest plea.  Joint recommendation:  W/H 24 mo probation - 90 days conditional jail time (Huber if qualifies), anger mgmt/counseling, letter of apology to Brian and Shonda Peat, no contact with Brian and Shonda Peat, DNA surcharge $250, restitution $779 to ICSO.  State objects to delayed report time.  Atty Waterman argues for delayed report time (Januray 2017) due to medical issues.  State requests a report date of 09/01/2016.  Defendant accepts that.

Defendant Wilmar M. Palmer in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There is an agreement in place and a PLEAS has been set but the DA would like a confirmed waiver of jury trial gone over with the defendant.  Defendant sworn.  CC Jackson reviewed the defendant's right(s) with the defendant in re a jury trial.  Defendant waives right to jury trial.  Knowing waiver accepted.  Scheduled PLEAS remains.

of 4/13/16 Motion Hearing

DA Larry Nelson appears for the State.  Atty Greg Waterman appears with defendant, Wilmar M. Palmer Jr.  Both attorneys have motions before the court.  Court hears DA Nelson.  DA would like to amend to 6 prior convictions.  Defendant's counsel is opposed.  Court hears DA Nelson.  Court hears Atty Waterman. Findings.  Motion to exclude Mr. Palmer's past convictions (6) is denied.  Court allows all past convictions from witnesses.
